definitions.text: any grammatical case other than the nominative
a diagonally arranged abdominal muscle on either side of the torso
slanting or inclined in direction or course or position--neither parallel nor perpendicular nor right-angled
examples: the oblique rays of the winter sun
acute and obtuse angles are oblique angles
the axis of an oblique cone is not perpendicular to its base

definitions.text: indirect in departing from the accepted or proper way; misleading
examples: used devious means to achieve success
gave oblique answers to direct questions
